availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in 1821. Farmer. Married Sophia Woodruff on January 19, 1856. Surveyed city of Eminence in 1854, giving right of way to I.C. & I. Railroad. Invented a wheat drill in 1865.

bibl.p: "Kentucky Marriages, 1785-1979," database, Gideon King and Sophia Woodruff, 19 Jan 1856; citing Shelby, Kentucky, reference; FHL microfilm 0216840 IT 2; Joyce K. Meyer, “Eminence Kentucky.” 2001.http://www.eminencekentucky.com/history.html; Acts of the Commonwealth of Kentucky Passed by the General Assembly. Vol 2. (Frankfort, Kentucky: John H. Harney, 1867).
